qas.question: What water sport is popular in the city?
What is the symbol of rowing in the city?
What is the name of the big rowing races?

answers.text: Dad Vail Regatta, the largest intercollegiate rowing event in the U.S, the Stotesbury Cup Regatta, and the Head of the Schuylkill Regatta

context: <a0_0>Rowing<a0_0/> has been popular in Philadelphia since the 18th century. <a1_0>Boathouse Row<a1_0/> is a symbol of Philadelphia's rich rowing history, and each Big Five member has its own boathouse. Philadelphia hosts numerous local and collegiate rowing clubs and competitions, including the annual <a2_0>Dad Vail Regatta, the largest intercollegiate rowing event in the U.S, the Stotesbury Cup Regatta, and the Head of the Schuylkill Regatta<a2_0/>, all of which are held on the <a3_0>Schuylkill River<a3_0/>. The regattas are hosted and organized by the Schuylkill Navy, an association of area rowing clubs that has produced numerous Olympic rowers.
